data.why:
This way, every one will be able to make one or more encodings
    default. It will also be possible to work around the problems with
    different codepages for files and terminals on Windows systems, to
    set special encodings for sockets and to use perl scripts written in
    non-ascii charsets.

    Encode::Default - Use default encodings for files and terminals

    Encode::Std - Unconfigured version of Encode::Default (override
    default)

    Encode::Default::Win32 - Autoselection of codepages by
    Encode::Default

    Decode::Source - Filter for scripts written in other encodings than
    utf8

    Most of the work is done and tested on PC/Windows, and partially on
    Cygwin.
